member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.NodeID
member.summary: Gets the Node ID of this device.
member.remarks: Each device in the network is given a network-unique Node ID when it is added to the network. Combined with the Home ID, this gives each device a globally unique identity.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that contains data about the ZWaveDevice.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.Groups
member.summary: Gets the association groups associated with the ZWaveDevice.
member.remarks: These groups should not be confused with a ZWaveController's ReplicationGroups, which are used to transfer groups of devices between controllers.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.Scenes
member.summary: Gets the scenes programmed into a ZWaveDevice.
member.remarks:
These scenes, made up of devices and their levels, are stored in the target device.
Not all Z-Wave devices support this advanced functionality.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.ConfigurationParameters
member.summary: Gets the configuration parameters of a ZWaveDevice.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.PowerOn
member.summary: If available, powers on the device; this is analagous to setting Level to 255.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.PowerOff
member.summary: If available, powers off the device; this is analagous to setting Level to 0.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.Ping
member.summary: Pings the device.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.AllOn
member.summary: Sends the All On command to a device.
member.remarks: A device will only respond to this command if its AllOnEnabled property has been set to True.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.AllOff
member.summary: Sends the All Off command to a device.
member.remarks: A device will only respond to this command if its AllOffEnabled property has been set to True.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.AllOnEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the All On Enabled state of a device. This is persisted by the target device.
member.remarks: Not all Z-Wave devices support this advanced functionality.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.AllOffEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the All Off Enabled state of a device. This is persisted by the target device.
member.remarks: Not all Z-Wave devices support this advanced functionality.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.Level
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of the device. Level is device-specific, but often 0 is off, 1 through 99 is a percentage, and 255 is a percentage-unknown on state."
member.remarks:
This feature is used for basic interoperability between Z-Wave devices.
Not all Z-Wave devices support this functionality.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.PollEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the device will be polled for property updates.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.PollInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how frequently a device will be polled for property updates. PollEnabled must be set to True for this property to have any effect.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets a name for the device (max: 16 chars). This is persisted inside the device.
member.remarks: Not all Z-Wave devices support this advanced functionality.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets a location for the device (max: 16 chars). This is persisted inside the device.
member.remarks: Not all Z-Wave devices support this advanced functionality.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice
member.summary: A generic device in a Z-Wave network; all devices inherit from this object unless their type is unknown.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Controller.IsPrimaryController
member.summary: Indicates if the controller is the Primary Controller in the network.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Controller
member.summary: A portable Z-Wave controller

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.StaticController.IsPrimaryController
member.summary: Indicates if the controller is the Primary Controller in the network.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.StaticController.IsStaticUpdateController
member.summary: Indicates if the controller is the Static Update Controller (SUC) in the network.
member.remarks: The Static Update Controller can create a new Primary controller if the Primary controller is lost or broken.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.StaticController
member.summary: A stationary Z-Wave controller

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.AVControlPoint
member.summary: A Z-Wave AV control point.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Thermostat
member.summary: A general Z-Wave thermostat; see Specific Thermostat device types for advanced functionality.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.WindowCovering
member.summary: A generic Z-Wave window covering; see Specific WindowCovering device types for advanced functionality.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.RepeaterSlave
member.summary: A Z-Wave repeater slave

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.BinarySwitch
member.summary: A Z-Wave Binary Switch, typically an on/off switch or plug-in appliance module

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.MultilevelSwitch.StartBrighten
member.summary: Start to brighten (or open/raise) the device.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.MultilevelSwitch.StartBrighten(System.Byte)
member.summary: Start to brighten (or open/raise) the device, starting at startLevel.
member.param: The level to start brightening from.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.MultilevelSwitch.StopBrighten
member.summary: Stop brightening (or opening/raising) the device.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.MultilevelSwitch.StartDim
member.summary: Start to dim (or close/lower) the device.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.MultilevelSwitch.StartDim(System.Byte)
member.summary: Start to dim (or close/lower) the device, starting at startLevel.
member.param: The level to start dimming from.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.MultilevelSwitch.StopDim
member.summary: Stop dimming (or closing/lowering) the device.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.MultilevelSwitch
member.summary: A Z-Wave Multilevel Switch, typically a dimmer switch, plug-in lamp module, or motor controller.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.RemoteSwitch
member.summary: A Z-Wave remote switch. Often referred to as a "virtual" switch.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ToggleSwitch
member.summary: A Z-Wave toggle switch.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.BinarySensor
member.summary: A Z-Wave binary (on/off) sensor, such as a simple motion sensor.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.PortableRemoteController
member.summary: A portable Z-Wave controller.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.PortableSceneController
member.summary: A portable Z-Wave scene controller.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.PcController
member.summary: A stationary Z-Wave PC controller, often a USB dongle or Ethernet bridge representing the attached PC.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.SceneController
member.summary: A stationary Z-Wave scene controller, such as an in-wall single- or multi-button controller.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.BinaryPowerSwitch
member.summary: A Z-Wave binary (on/off) power switch.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.BinarySceneSwitch
member.summary: A Z-Wave binary (on/off) scene switch.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.MultilevelPowerSwitch
member.summary: A Z-Wave multilevel (dimmable) power switch.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.MultilevelSceneSwitch
member.summary: A Z-Wave multilevel (dimmable) scene switch.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.MultipositionMotor
member.summary: A Z-Wave motor controller, often a window covering or plasma lift.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.SatelliteReceiver
member.summary: A Z-Wave satellite receiver.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.GeneralThermostat.ThermostatMode
member.summary: Get or set the current thermostat mode.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.GeneralThermostat.SupportedThermostatModes
member.summary: Gets a list of thermostat modes supported by this general thermostat.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.GeneralThermostat.ThermostatOperatingState
member.summary: Get or set the current thermostat operating state (cooling, heating, etc.)
member.remarks: Not all thermostats support this advanced functionality.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.GeneralThermostat.ThermostatSetpoints
member.summary: The collection of setpoints used by this thermostat.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.GeneralThermostat.SupportedThermostatSetpoints
member.summary: Gets a list of setpoints supported by this thermostat.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.GeneralThermostat.ThermostatFanMode
member.summary: Get or set the current thermostat fan mode.
member.remarks: Not all thermostats support this advanced functionality.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.GeneralThermostat.SupportedThermostatFanModes
member.summary: Gets a list of thermostat fan modes supported by this general thermostat.
member.remarks: Not all thermostats support this advanced functionality.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.GeneralThermostat.ThermostatFanState
member.summary: Get or set the current thermostat fan state (RunningHigh, Idle, etc.)
member.remarks: Not all thermostats support this advanced functionality.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.GeneralThermostat.ThermostatTemperature
member.summary: Gets the current thermostat temperature.
member.remarks: Not all thermostats support this advanced functionality.

member.summary: A Z-Wave general thermostat, often used to control HVAC systems.

member.summary: Get or set the current thermostat mode.

member.summary: Get or set the current thermostat operating state (cooling, heating, etc.)
member.remarks: Not all thermostats support this advanced functionality.

member.summary: The collection of setpoints used by this thermostat.

member.remarks: Not all thermostats support this advanced functionality.

member.summary: Get or set the current thermostat fan state (RunningHigh, Idle, etc.)

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.SimpleWindowCovering.StartOpen
member.summary: Start to open the window covering.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.SimpleWindowCovering.StartClose
member.summary: Start to close the window covering.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.SimpleWindowCovering.StopOpen
member.summary: Stop opening the window covering.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.SimpleWindowCovering.StopClose
member.summary: Stop closing the window covering.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.SimpleWindowCovering
member.summary: A Z-Wave Simple Window Covering, used by some window shades. Others use MultipositionMotor.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.BasicRepeaterSlave
member.summary: A Z-Wave Basic Repeater Slave, generally used to repeat Z-Wave signals.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.BinaryRemoteSwitch
member.summary: A Z-Wave binary (on/off) remote switch.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.MultilevelRemoteSwitch
member.summary: A Z-Wave multilevel (dimmable) remote switch.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.BinaryToggleRemoteSwitch
member.summary: A Z-Wave binary (on/off) toggle remote switch.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.MultilevelToggleRemoteSwitch
member.summary: A Z-Wave multilevel (dimmable) toggle remote switch.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.Specific.RoutingBinarySensor
member.summary: A Z-Wave routing binary sensor.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.ControllerNotRespondingException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the connected Z-Wave Controller did not respond properly.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.CommandAbortedException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the current command has been aborted.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.DeviceNotRespondingException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the target device does not respond to our request.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.NetworkBusyException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the network is too busy; please try again later.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.CommandTimeoutException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the request has timed out.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.CommandNotStartedTimeoutException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the command timed out before it could be issued to the device.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.CommandResponseInvalidException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an invalid response is received.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.CommandRejectedException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the request is rejected by the target device.
member.remarks: This can occur when a device is in a security mode which forbids the request, is in an invalid state, etc.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.CommandDelayedException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the target device has queued the request for later operation.
member.remarks: This exception should be used for informational purposes, and the request should not be repeated.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.DeviceBusyException.TimeToWait
member.summary: Gets the amount of time to wait before resubmitting the request (or zero to wait until later)

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.DeviceBusyException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the target device is too busy to process the request.
member.remarks: If TimeToWait is greater than zero seconds, wait that amount of time before resubmitting the request; otherwise, wait until later to resubmit.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Stopwatch
member.summary: This Stopwatch is designed to provide System.Diagnostics.Stopwatch capabilities where otherwise unavailable

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.DeviceUpdateEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the event handler that will handle a DeviceAdded/Removed/Replaced event.

member.name: E:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.DeviceAdded
member.summary: This event occurs when a device is added to the network (or when a device is first discovered upon connection).

member.name: E:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.DeviceRemoved
member.summary: This event occurs when a device is removed from the network.

member.name: E:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.DeviceReplaced
member.summary: This event occurs when a device is replaced in the network.
member.remarks: The replaced device will have the same Node ID as the original device.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.SceneActivatedEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the event handler that will handle a SceneActivated event.

member.name: E:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.SceneActivated
member.summary: This event occurs when the active scene is changed in our device by a device on our network.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.LevelChangedEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the event handler that will handle a LevelChanged event.

member.name: E:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.LevelChanged
member.summary: This event occurs when our virtual indicator level is changed by a device on our network.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ConfigurationChangeEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the event handler that will handle a BeforeConfigurationChange or AfterConfigurationChange event.

member.name: E:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.BeforeConfigurationChange
member.summary: This event occurs before the ZWaveController's configuration changes during a ReceiveConfiguration operation.

member.name: E:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.AfterConfigurationChange
member.summary: This event occurs after the ZWaveController's configuration changes during a ReceiveConfiguration operation.

member.name: E:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ControllerNotResponding
member.summary: This event occurs when the attached controller is not responding. This may indicate a transitory issue or a permanent fault.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReplicationGroup
member.summary: A group of devices, to be sent or received when adding a controller into the network or being added to the network.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReplicationScene
member.summary: A group of devices and their associated levels, to be sent or received when adding a controller into the network or being added to the network.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReplicationSceneItem
member.summary: A device and its level, to be sent or received in a ReplicationSceneCollection when adding a controller into the network or being added to the network.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReplicationSceneItemCollection
member.summary: A collection of devices and their levels, to be sent or received in a ReplicationScene when adding a controller into the network or being added to the network.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.Connect
member.summary: Connects to a Z-Wave USB dongle or Ethernet bridge

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.Connect(System.String)
member.summary: Connects to a Z-Wave serial controller.
member.param: The COM port of a Z-Wave serial controller (ex: "COM1")

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.Connect(System.Net.IPEndPoint)
member.summary: Connects to a Z-Wave Ethernet bridge.
member.param: The IPEndPoint of a Z-Wave Ethernet bridge

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.RemoveFailedDevice(ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice)
member.summary: Removes a broken/missing device from the ZWaveController's network map.
member.param: The broken/missing ZWaveDevice to remove
member.returns: True if the removal process succeeded; False if the device is not broken or could not be removed.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.BeginReplaceFailedDevice(ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous operation to replace a broken/missing device with a new device.
member.param: The broken/missing ZWaveDevice to replace
An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the operation is complete
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous request from other requests
member.returns: A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.EndReplaceFailedDevice(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends a pending broken/missing device replacement
member.param: A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation
member.returns: A ZWaveDevice object representing the new device, or Nothing if the operation failed

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReplaceFailedDevice(ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice)
member.summary: Replaces a broken/missing device with a new device, preserving the same Node ID.
member.param: The broken/missing ZWaveDevice to replace
member.returns: A ZWaveDevice object representing the new device, or Nothing if the operation failed

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.RediscoverDevice(ControlThink.ZWave.Devices.ZWaveDevice)
member.summary: Rediscovers a ZWaveDevice in the network and updates the map of its direct neighbors
member.param: The ZWaveDevice to rediscover
member.returns: True if the rediscovery succeeded; False if the device could not be rediscovered.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects from the connected Z-Wave connection.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.HardReset
member.summary: Resets the ZWaveController to its factory defaults.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.HardReset(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resets the ZWaveController to its factory defaults.
member.param: Set to True if this ZWaveController will always remain in the same location and powered on.
member.remarks: The alwaysOnAndStationary property determines whether a device will be used as a stationary repeater in the network. If it is set to True but the device is powered down or physically moved, network slowdowns and/or failures may occur.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.BeginReceiveConfiguration(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous operation to join/leave a network or receive an updated network map.
member.param: An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the operation is complete
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous request from other requests
member.returns: A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation
member.remarks: If the ZWaveController is currently a Secondary controller on a network, it must first be HardReset before it can join another network using this method.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.EndReceiveConfiguration(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends a pending network join/leave/update operation
member.param: A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation
member.returns: True if the operation succeeded; False if the operation failed.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.EndReceiveConfiguration(System.IAsyncResult,ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReplicationGroup[]@,ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReplicationScene[]@)
member.summary: Ends a pending network join/leave/update operation, and saves any scenes or groups captured during the replication process.
member.param: >A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation
An empty array of ReplicationGroup objects, which will be replaced by any group information captured during the replication process.
An empty array of ReplicationScenes objects, which will be replaced by any scene information captured during the replication process.
member.returns: True if the operation succeeded; False if the operation failed.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReceiveConfiguration
member.summary: Causes the ZWaveController to join/leave a network or receive an updated network map.
member.returns: True if the operation succeeded; False if the operation failed.
member.remarks: If the ZWaveController is currently a Secondary controller on a network, it must first be HardReset before it can join another network using this method.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReceiveConfiguration(ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReplicationGroup[]@,ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReplicationScene[]@)
member.summary: Causes the ZWaveController to join/leave a network or receive an updated network map, and saves any scenes or groups captured during the replication process.
member.param: An empty array of ReplicationGroup objects, which will be replaced by any group information captured during the replication process.
An empty array of ReplicationScenes objects, which will be replaced by any scene information captured during the replication process.
member.remarks: If the ZWaveController is currently a Secondary controller on a network, it must first be HardReset before it can join another network using this method.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.BeginCreateNewPrimaryController(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous operation to create a new Primary controller.
member.param: An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the operation is complete
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous request from other requests
member.returns: A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation
member.remarks: The ZWaveController must be a Static Update Controller (network backup) to create a new Primary controller.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.EndCreateNewPrimaryController(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends a pending operation to create a new Primary controller.
member.param: A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation
member.returns: A ZWaveDevice object representing the new Primary controller, or Nothing if the operation failed.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.CreateNewPrimaryController
member.summary: Creates a new Primary controller.
member.returns: A ZWaveDevice object representing the new Primary controller, or Nothing if the operation failed.
member.remarks: The ZWaveController must be a Static Update Controller (network backup) to create a new Primary controller.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.CreateNewPrimaryController(ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReplicationGroup[],ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReplicationScene[])
member.summary: Creates a new Primary controller, and copies scenes and/or groups during the replication process.
member.param: An array of ReplicationGroup objects, which will be transmitted to the target controller during the replication process.
An array of ReplicationScene objects, which will be transmitted to the target controller during the replication process.
member.returns: A ZWaveDevice object representing the new Primary controller, or Nothing if the operation failed.
member.remarks: The ZWaveController must be a Static Update Controller (network backup) to create a new Primary controller.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.BeginTransferPrimaryRole(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous operation to transfer the Primary role to another controller.
member.param: An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the operation is complete
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous request from other requests
member.returns: A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation
member.remarks: The ZWaveController must be the Primary controller to transfer the Primary role to another controller.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.EndTransferPrimaryRole(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends a pending transfer of the Primary role to another controller
member.param: A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation
member.returns: A ZWaveDevice object representing the new Primary controller, or Nothing if the operation failed.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.TransferPrimaryRole
member.summary: Transfers the Primary role to another controller.
member.returns: A ZWaveDevice object representing the new Primary controller, or Nothing if the operation failed.
member.remarks: The ZWaveController must be the Primary controller to transfer the Primary role to another controller.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.TransferPrimaryRole(ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReplicationGroup[],ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReplicationScene[])
member.summary: Transfers the Primary role to another controller, and copies scenes and/or groups during the replication process.
member.param: An array of ReplicationGroup objects, which will be transmitted to the target controller during the replication process.
An array of ReplicationScene objects, which will be transmitted to the target controller during the replication process.
member.returns: A ZWaveDevice object representing the new Primary controller, or Nothing if the operation failed.
member.remarks: The ZWaveController must be the Primary controller to transfer the Primary role to another controller.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.AbortCreateNewPrimaryController
member.summary: Aborts a pending operation to create a new Primary controller

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.AbortTransferPrimaryRole
member.summary: Aborts a pending operation to transfer the Primary role to another controller.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.AbortReceiveConfiguration
member.summary: Aborts a pending operation to join/leave/update the network

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.AbortAddController
member.summary: Aborts a pending operation to add a controller to the network.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.AbortAddDevice
member.summary: Aborts a pending operation to add a device to the network.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.AbortReplaceFailedDevice
member.summary: Aborts a pending operation to replace a broken device in the network.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.AbortRemoveController
member.summary: Aborts a pending operation to remove a controller from the network.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.AbortRemoveDevice
member.summary: Aborts a pending operation to remove a device from the network.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.BeginAddController(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous operation to add a controller to the network.
member.param: An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the operation is complete
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous request from other requests
member.returns: A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation
member.remarks: The ZWaveController must be the Primary controller to add a controller to the network. Also, the target remote must be put into replication receive mode, which is sometimes known as Join Network.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.BeginAddController(ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReplicationGroup[],ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReplicationScene[],System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous operation to add a controller to the network, and copies scenes and/or groups during the replication process.
member.param: An array of ReplicationGroup objects, which will be transmitted to the target controller during the replication process.
An array of ReplicationScene objects, which will be transmitted to the target controller during the replication process.
An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the operation is complete
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous request from other requests
member.returns: A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation
member.remarks: The ZWaveController must be the Primary controller to add a controller to the network. Also, the target remote must be put into replication receive mode, which is sometimes known as Join Network.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.EndAddController(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends a pending addition of a controller to the network
member.param: A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation
member.returns: A ZWaveDevice object representing the newly-added controller, or Nothing if the operation failed.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.AddController
member.summary: Adds a controller to the network, or updates the network map in an existing controller on the network.
member.returns: A ZWaveDevice object representing the newly-added controller, or Nothing if the operation failed.
member.remarks: The ZWaveController must be the Primary controller to add a controller to the network. Also, the target remote must be put into replication receive mode, which is sometimes known as Join Network (or Receive Network Update).

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.AddController(ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReplicationGroup[],ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ReplicationScene[])
member.summary: Adds a controller to the network, or updates the network map in an existing controller on the network.
member.param: An array of ReplicationGroup objects, which will be transmitted to the target controller during the replication process.
An array of ReplicationScene objects, which will be transmitted to the target controller during the replication process.
member.returns: A ZWaveDevice object representing the newly-added controller, or Nothing if the operation failed.
member.remarks: The ZWaveController must be the Primary controller to add a controller to the network. Also, the target remote must be put into replication receive mode, which is sometimes known as Join Network (or Receive Network Update).

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.BeginAddDevice(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous operation to add a device to the network.
member.param: An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the operation is complete
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous request from other requests
member.returns: A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation
member.remarks: The ZWaveController must be the Primary controller to add a device to the network. Once this function is called, press the program button on the target device to complete the addition process.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.EndAddDevice(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends a pending addition of a device to the network
member.param: A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation
member.returns: A ZWaveDevice object representing the newly-added device, or Nothing if the operation failed.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.AddDevice
member.summary: Adds a device to the network.
member.returns: A ZWaveDevice object representing the newly-added device, or Nothing if the operation failed.
member.remarks: The ZWaveController must be the Primary controller to add a device to the network. Once this function is called, press the program button on the target device to complete the addition process.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.BeginRemoveController(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous operation to remove a controller from the network.
member.param: An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the operation is complete
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous request from other requests
member.returns: A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation
member.remarks: The ZWaveController must be the Primary controller to remove a controller from the network. Also, the target remote must be put into replication receive mode, which is sometimes known as Receive Network Update or Leave Network.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.EndRemoveController(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends a pending removal of a controller from the network
member.param: A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation
member.returns: A ZWaveDevice object representing the removed controller, or Nothing if the operation failed.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.RemoveController
member.summary: Removes a controller from the network.
member.returns: A ZWaveDevice object representing the removed controller, or Nothing if the operation failed.
member.remarks: The ZWaveController must be the Primary controller to remove a controller from the network. Also, the target remote must be put into replication receive mode, which is sometimes known as Receive Network Update or Leave Network.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.BeginRemoveDevice(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous operation to remove a device from the network.
member.param: An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the operation is complete
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous request from other requests
member.returns: A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation
member.remarks: The ZWaveController must be the Primary controller to remove a device from the network. Once this function is called, press the program button on the target device to complete the removal process.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.EndRemoveDevice(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends a pending removal of a device from the network
member.param: A System.IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous operation
member.returns: A ZWaveDevice object representing the removed device, or Nothing if the operation failed.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.RemoveDevice
member.summary: Removes a device from the network.
member.returns: A ZWaveDevice object representing the removed device, or Nothing if the operation failed.
member.remarks: The ZWaveController must be the Primary controller to remove a device from the network. Once this function is called, press the program button on the target device to complete the removal process.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.Level
member.summary: Gets or sets the virtual indicator level.
member.value: The virtual indicator level. Valid values are 0 (off), 255 (on) and 1 to 99 (1 = 1%, 99 = 100%).
member.returns: The virtual indicator level. Valid values are 0 (off), 255 (on) and 1 to 99 (1 = 1%, 99 = 100%).
member.remarks: To associate this level with a scene on a remote control, follow the standard instructions for adding a device to a scene as provided in the remote's user's manual. Then, call the EmitDeviceInformation function to alert the remote that you would like this ZWaveController and this specific level to be associated with the scene.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.ActiveSceneID
member.summary: Gets or sets the active Scene ID.
member.value: The active Scene ID. Value values are 0 (no active scene) and 1 to 255.
member.returns: The active scene ID. Value values are 0 (no active scene) and 1 to 255.

member.name: M:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.EmitDeviceInformation
member.summary: Emits the ZWaveController's device information.
member.remarks: This is often used to identify a device or associate its level with a particular button on a remote, etc.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets whether the ZWaveController is currently connected to a USB dongle, Ethernet bridge, etc.
member.value: True if the ZWaveController is currently connected; otherwise, False.
member.returns: True if the ZWaveController is currently connected; otherwise, False.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.Devices
member.summary: Gets a collection of all the devices in the ZWaveController's network which are known to this ZWaveController.
member.value: A collection of all the devices known to the ZWaveController in its network.
member.returns: A collection of all the devices known to the ZWaveController in its network.
member.remarks: If this ZWaveController is a secondary controller, you can update its network map by adding it to the network again and calling the ReceiveConfiguration function.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.HomeID
member.summary: Gets the 32-bit Home ID of the ZWaveController's network.
member.value: The 32-bit Home ID of the ZWaveController's network
member.returns: The 32-bit Home ID of the ZWaveController's network
member.remarks: This value is assigned by the Primary controller of the network, and is stored in all network devices.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.NodeID
member.summary: Gets the Node ID of the ZWaveController.
member.value: The Node ID of the ZWaveController
member.returns: The Node ID of the ZWaveController
member.remarks: Each device in the network is given a network-unique Node ID when it is added to the network. Combined with the Home ID, this gives each device a globally unique identity.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.IsPrimaryController
member.summary: Indicates if the controller is the Primary Controller in the network.
member.remarks: The ZWaveController must be a Primary Controller to add or remove devices from the network.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.IsStaticUpdateController
member.summary: Indicates if the controller is the Static Update Controller (SUC) in the network.
member.remarks: The Static Update Controller can create a new Primary controller if the Primary controller is lost or broken.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController.SynchronizingObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the object used to marshal event-handler calls. (optional)

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.ZWaveController
member.summary: Provides access to communicate with a Z-Wave network through an attached Z-Wave USB dongle, Ethernet bridge, etc.

member.name: P:ControlThink.ZWave.Licensing.LicenseKey
member.summary: Gets the license key used by this managed code driver.

member.name: T:ControlThink.ZWave.Licensing
member.summary: Provides access to the current licensing information for the managed code driver.
